Keyboard activates on return to the app
description:
### Summary

Everytime you return to the app the keyboard pops up.

### Steps to reproduce

Leave the app for the home screen or another app. Return to the app.

### Platform information

Android, 3.16.0 test build

### App version

3.16.0 Test build

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

keyboard pops up on return to the app

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

keyboard should not pop up

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

Fully implement flow static analysis for react native
description:
Now that flow has better support for Typescript, we need to update our mobile-native configuration to do static analysis at the CI level and catch any type errors / null

- [X] Upgrade our type script typing and make sure we've got our stack up to date.
- [X] Make the app compile with type script
- [X] Add static analysis checking to the CI flow
- [X] Make sure the app builds and deploys
- [ ] Roll out complete type checking so we can catch all the errors
- [ ] Enable Prettier at the CI level

The onboarding date of birth selector needs to limit underagers
description:
We need to stop underagers from being able to onboard 

- [ ] Limit the minimum year to 13 years in the past in the dob selector

title: Add retry logic to images
description:
Implement a retry logic for images with delay. This will reduce the "Error loading media" with intermittent connectivity.

Also, if all the retries fail, we can hook the component to the connectivity service to try to reload the images when the connectivity status change

![image](/uploads/b60ed97bbfe7e321b243c440062eea64/image.png)

![image](/uploads/8ae5253163fe2f3ac1ff4fd84970fc36/image.png)

title: Handle expired email verification links
description:
### Design links

* Normal verification sheet - https://www.sketch.com/s/1f4ae3ad-52df-407e-a74d-1a37bc8d0319/a/rb57mrE/r/Dnmbnk
* Verified state - https://www.sketch.com/s/1f4ae3ad-52df-407e-a74d-1a37bc8d0319/a/oY5wEr0
* Link expired state - https://www.sketch.com/s/1f4ae3ad-52df-407e-a74d-1a37bc8d0319/a/m1WYnGw

From @benhayward.ben 

When a user follows an invalid email verification link, display an error

- [ ] Display a "Your verification request has expired." error but do not trigger a resend. We don't want to create a loop caused by people clicking on the back end. Better to capture this process asynchronoysly and make sure we redisplay the verification when they resend


Based off feedback in thread: https://gitlab.com/minds/front/merge_requests/699#note_263718217

title: Give old users option to do new onboarding
description:
- [ ] Create a "Setup your account" link on the channel screen (on the existing screen for channels)
- [ ] Setup a "Finish setting up your account" that displays if the user has not completed onboarding that displays after the "verify your email" banner
- [ ] For old users, who have not completed onboarding, display the banner.
- [ ] Setup an "onboarding-reminder" feature flag so we can roll this out to specific users.

@ottman @markeharding , rolling this out. Please, review the messaging and give feedback for the simplest version of being able to re-onboard I could come up with (mobile version)

description:
We want to roll out our new onboarding ui, but the recommendations need to be overhauled. We'll be turning them back on when get the recommendations engine sorted out. Let's try to get onboarding turned on by Monday
- [x] enable the new onboarding ff by default
- [x] disable (but keep) the suggested channels onboarding step
- [x] disable (but keep) the suggested groups onboarding step
- [x] onboarding should flow as normal
- [x] disable the e2e tests that check for groups and onboarding

New Posts have a scheduled time of now bar
description:
### Summary

When you create a new image or video post. It will have a schedule release time of the current time when posted. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Make an image or video post

### Platform information

Android

### App version

3.15.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

New Posts have scheduled time now banner

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Posts that aren't scheduled should not have a scheduled time bar on them.

title: Date picker for onboarding needs to not send a date unless they choose one
description:
During onboarding, the date picker defaults to today and sends the dob to the channel endpoint

Set a private field that gets cleared when the date is changed

Only send the dob if they change it

title: Onboarding 3.15.0 Clean up
description:
- [ ] Android date picker used for Date of Birth is Optimized for Calendar Scheduling.  Use a different datepicker, or somehow tweak the mode of the datepicker so it is easier to go back multiple years.

description:
Engine is now the source of truth for mobile.

We need to go through our flags and remove the logic and functionality for any ones not defined in engine

title: Align login input icon both platforms
Compose post actions bottom bar
description:
Implement the post actions bottom bar


Clicking on the post options button should slide up a panel that allows for advanced configuration
### Options
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard9
- [ ] Tagging
- [ ] NSFW
- [ ] Scheduling post
- [ ] Monetize
- [ ] Visibility
- [ ] License

title: Compose top bar
description:
Implement the meatball menu on the top right on the new composer modal

Owners and admins should be able to toggle the option. 

Non owners and non admins should see the menus as read only with what is currently selected. They should see the top level text "Visibility" and "License" replaced with the currently selected option

Owner/admin needs to be able to toggle licensing just like on the current blogs editor. 

Owner/admin needs to be able to toggle visibility like the old media viewer


### License screen
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard17

### Visibility 
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard18



- [ ] Clicking the meatball menu should display the toolbar
- [ ] Bring over the existing meatball menu so we can have existing functionality
- [ ] Put the two new toggles on the top
- [ ] Admins and owners should be able to interact with the meatball menu
- [ ] None owners should only see read only information
- [ ] light mode
- [ ] dark mode
- [ ] unit tests
- [ ] e2e tests
- [ ] responsive design
- [ ] point MR 3.16.0 branch

title: The plus button on the new nav bar should open the new capture screen
description:
On the new nav ui, the plus button needs to open a new composer component that can switch between video, camera and text

### Video capture
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard1

### Image capture
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard2

### Text capture
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard5

- [ ] setup a new feature flag called "compose" and make it unleash-able
- [ ] Default to the video capture and enable the local device video capture
- [ ] Allow switching between the video, image and text modes
- [ ] Light mode
- [ ] dark mode
- [ ] behind a "compose" feature flag that responds to the new unleash changes on the backend
- [ ] unit tests
- [ ] e2e tests

title: Clean up styles for light mode and dark mode
description:
To enable the styles for light mode and dark mode, we need to unify our styles and clean them up into themes

- [ ] Don't change the old screens, we're only rolling light and dark mode for the rewrite
- [ ] Make sure we have themes for nav, composer and onboarding
- [ ] clean up our styles into light mode and dark mode themes

title: Forgot password screen for the new mobile design
Remove register animation
Remove login/register FF conditionals and code cleanup
Change minds settings and feature flag loading logic
Old landing page still accessible on mobile
description:
### Summary

Onle landing page is still accessible

### Steps to reproduce

From login
1. Join Minds Now
2. Click back button
3. See old landing page
4. fill out information to register a new channel
5. go to new registration to fill out information again

### Platform information

Android

### App version

3.15.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Can navigate to old landing page

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Old landing page should auto redirect to new login.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![old_landing](/uploads/45a8e1f59b826b88df5b908d6464ed1e/old_landing.mp4)

title: Hardware back button should send us to previous onboarding step
description:
When doing onboarding, on android, the backbutton should send us to previous step.

This task comes from #1732

title: Document unleash client functionality on the repository and launch our Beta
description:
We need to have full usage instructions on how to use our unleash client. This should be as community facing as possible, so we can send it over to Unleash and get the accolades we deserve.

- [ ] Add a status badge to show the state of our tests
- [ ] Make sure master is protected and we can only push in via MRs
- [ ] Document environment variables and configuration
- [ ] Installation instructions
- [ ] Document using our strategies
- [ ] Document Gitlab integration
- [ ] Publish our vendor package

When this is done, I'll send it over to the unleash maintainers for linking and feedback

title: 3.15 onboarding issues for iOS
description:
- [x] Cannot scroll through hashtag selector

![IMG_4155](/uploads/641a1f9872a59b075b0410453d81fb82/IMG_4155.PNG)

- [x] Suggested groups and channels you join/subscribe do not populate in the newsfeed when you land there

- [x] Location does not populate on your channel description when you land there

- [x] Sizing issues with skip buttons, "No thanks ill do this later" and terms check box

![IMG_4155](/uploads/cf572d153b1e975bd04be181c5dd68be/IMG_4155.PNG)

![IMG_4153](/uploads/f9fc47af5c6d4bee6b326b77db60cc0d/IMG_4153.PNG)

![IMG_4149](/uploads/f8ce7970daf4af272f5c30ebd5921c92/IMG_4149.PNG)

- [x] Onboarding wizard appeared for "jack" account which is an existing account, should not appear for existing accounts

- [x] Onboarding wizard appeared for new created channel after quitting/relaunching app despite completion

![Untitled](/uploads/ac134f53ad5da57f477750725e14c5ce/Untitled.mp4)

![IMG_4148](/uploads/40faca3c92fec4c482a5a3dfa02b652b/IMG_4148.PNG)

![RPReplay_Final1579888036](/uploads/5b33b9600b5438ca7d4ffee9e09a9342/RPReplay_Final1579888036.MP4)

![RPReplay_Final1579888144](/uploads/e090c025b7a1b78c3d0e12c926093bca/RPReplay_Final1579888144.MP4)

title: new onboarding needs to sample 1y for channels and groups
description: When we call the top feeds endpoint to get the groups and the channels, we need to use the 1y parameter so it's more stable

title: Upgrade our reactive native date picker component
description: @juanmsolaro reports that our date picker has been moved to reactive native community edition

title: Android is still loading the old onboarding
description:
I verified that feature flags are on on android

Installed the android apk from here
https://minds-repo.s3.amazonaws.com/mobile/Minds-release-3-15-0.apk

But when I create a new account, the old onboarding is firing.

title: TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'o.some')
description:
IOS, 3.15.0

Install the app
Try to onboard a new user with the urls pointed to Walrus. (handled in the build)
Crash after account creation

Sentry Issue: [MOBILE-V2](https://sentry.io/organizations/minds-inc/issues/1464597359/?referrer=gitlab_integration)

```
TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'o.some')
  File "src/onboarding/OnboardingScreen.js", line 71, in render
    if (!completed_items.some(r => r == 'suggested_hashtags')) {
  File "app:///[native code]", in ml
  File "app:///[native code]", in fl
  File "src/navigation/NavigationService.js", line 35, in push
    _navigator.dispatch(
  File "src/onboarding/OnboardingStore.js", line 49, in call
    NavigationService.push(onboarding);
...
(29 additional frame(s) were not displayed)
```

title: Upgrade sentry on Mobile
description: There's been active development on sentry.io. We need to upgrade our mobile-native package to get all the latest and greatest

title: Simplify and audit our feature flags
description:
We're rolling out our new unleash feature flag service

For mobile that consumes that talks to the FF api and ships with a config file not much is going to change. The export and the service will return what flags are white listed in https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/issues/1318

For the ongoing rewrite, we need to combine the various onboarding, nav and product pages into one new-design flag

* [ ] make sure the feature flags defaults defined in the app are up to date
* [ ] combine new design flags into new-design
* [ ] audit feature flags on app. Remove any that are no longer in use
* [ ] make sure app responds to turning the feature flags on and off via gitlab's unleash api

title: Implement dark mode / light mode switcher
description:
- [ ] Add a button to the settings menu to switch between light mode and dark mode
- [ ] Have the setting persist locally so when a user logs in, they will have their selected mode
- [ ] Make sure switching is performant
- [ ] Should be behind a ```dark-mode``` feature flag controllable by unleash
@msantang78, @juanmsolaro set up the dark mode styles for the app. We can turn them on with a switch. This card is for adding the user toggle and making sure that we won't have performance problems with switching themes in mobx

title: TypeError: JSON.stringify cannot serialize cyclic structures.
description:

```
TypeError: JSON.stringify cannot serialize cyclic structures.
  File "app:///[native code]", in stringify
  File "src/common/services/sql/entities.storage.js", line 27, in call
    {snip} xecuteSql('REPLACE INTO entities (urn, data, updated) values (?,?,?)', [entity.urn, JSON.stringify(entity), Math.floor(Date.now() / 1000)]);
  File "app:///[native code]", in callImmediates
  File "app:///[native code]", in value
  File "app:///[native code]", in value
...
(14 additional frame(s) were not displayed)
```

```

    at src/common/services/crypto.service.value(crypto.service.js:31)
    return this.publicKeys;
    at src/messenger/conversation/Message.(Message.js:52)
    setTimeout(() => {
...
```
